sentences.sContent: The assassination triggered off a wave of rioting.
sentences.sCn: 这次暗杀事件引发了一阵骚乱。

sentences.sContent: Certain forms of mental illness can be triggered by food allergies.
sentences.sCn: 某些精神疾病可能由食物过敏引发。

sentences.sContent: His action triggered a massive response from the government.
sentences.sCn: 他的行动引发了政府的巨大反应。

trans.tranOther: to make something happen very quickly, especially a series of events
the part of a gun that you pull with your finger to fire it
